topic.title: Now Available: Foreign Relations of the United States, 1977–1980, Volume XXII, Southeast Asia and the Pacific
topic.body: This volume is part of a Foreign Relations subseries that documents the most important foreign policy issues of the Jimmy Carter administration. The focus of this volume is on the administration’s largely reactive policy towards the countries in Southeast Asia, as well as substantial documentation on refugee policy and narcotics trafficking, which were important regional issues.
